rationale: The phrase 'highly contagious bird flu virus' contains the intensifier 'highly' modifying the risk-adjective 'contagious'. It is not followed by a specific virus name like H5N1/HPAI, so the technical-term guard does not apply.
statement_text: Brazil has raised chicken production even after the arrival of the highly contagious bird flu virus, which was detected in national territory for the first time in May but has not contaminated commercial poultry farms.
